availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. White (Madison County, printer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, printer and soldier. Madison County native. Son of James White and Francis White. Married to Rebecca Ann Gay White on December 29, 1858. Father of John W. White, Mary White, and George White. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Printer in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 8, 1861 to October 13, 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from November 1864 to November 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 205B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision, p. 128.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 7.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000183316, p. 210.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 145 and 177.
Find A Grave, "George W White (1837-1902)," Memorial #31600906, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31600906# (accessed December 11, 2018).
